snippet: At Pomona College, dining hall employees were fired after questions about their residency status, prompting a debate over what it means to be a liberal college.
abstract: Incident in which Pomona College officials dismissed seventeen long-time dining hall employees over questions about their residency status has provoked a fierce on-campus debate over the role a liberal arts college should play regarding immigration; some students, faculty and alumni have accused the administration of betraying the college's ideals.
lead_paragraph: At Pomona College, dining hall employees were fired after questions about their residency status, prompting a debate over what it means to be a liberal college.

headline.seo: Immigrant Worker Firings Unsettle Pomona College
